questions.question_text: Read the following passage and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: This city of Saudi Arabia, is focal point to all of the Muslims throughout the world. Since the Muhammadan Era the pilgrim traffic has been the chief economic activity of the district. Makkah itself, with a population of more than 90,000 is situated on an alluvial filled valley, and the produce of its oasis can support less than 1/5th of its present. Inhabitants. Upto 1952 there was a heavy tax on all pilgrims (110 dollars per head) which was the financial mainstay of the Saudi Arabian state, but with all royalties the tax has been abolished Pilgrims now number over 1.5 million annually during the Hajj season which lasts about 4-6 weeks. The Saudi Government now makes great efforts to house pilgrims and provide internal transport (besides imposing health regulations and attempting to prevent settlement by foreign pilgrims). With the new fervor sweeping through Islamic countries, the moral and social effects of undertaking pilgrimage under same austerity are now increasingly esteemed.
